value.title: Import your excel model into Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you spent hours creating an excel model with Power Query and PowerPivot and you or your company has now decided to move to Power BI?  Well, don't worry, you can import your excel models in Power BI and most of it will be imported, included the visuals if you created them using Power View, Yey!

value.title: Monitor usage with Power BI audit logs
value.excerpt: You can turn on audit logs in Power BI to monitor what users are doing in Power BI. This tool is perfect for troubleshoot and to help you document what is being done in Power BI and use it to comply with laws like GDPR.  To turn it on, you need an E3 or E5 office 365 license. If you have it, you just

value.title: Row Level Security in Power BI desktop - Power BI Tips & Tricks #27
value.excerpt: In this video we will see how to add Row Level security to your Power BI data.  Row Level security is used to restrict data access for given users. Filters restrict data at the row level. You can define filters within roles. What is Row Level Security: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-admin-rls/
